question: Which state becomes the first in India to provide free & cashless insurance cover to its people, amidst Covid-19?
explanation:
The state Government of Maharashtra announced that all citizens of the state would be covered under the state governmentâ€™s health scheme, thereby becoming the first state in India to provide free & cashless insurance cover to its people.
About 85 per cent of the state's population was already covered under the Mahatma Jyotiba Phule Jan Arogya Yojana (MJPJAY) at present and the cover will be extended to the remaining 15 per cent. The state has signed a MoU to include the government, semi- government employees and white ration card holders in the scheme.
